titleStmt.title: (Here all may see, that) justice and judgement is to rule. And the power of God without respecting mens persons, or observing the worlds complements. And sheweth how the pure religion keeps out from the spots of the world. ... And sheweth the prisoning for not bowing the hat, is such a thing as hath not been since the world began.
titleStmt.author: Fox, George, 1624-1691.

titleStmt.title: (Here all may see, that) justice and judgement is to rule. And the power of God without respecting mens persons, or observing the worlds complements. And sheweth how the pure religion keeps out from the spots of the world. ... And sheweth the prisoning for not bowing the hat, is such a thing as hath not been since the world began.
titleStmt.author: Fox, George, 1624-1691.

publicationStmt.publisher: Printed for Thomas Simmons at the signe of the Bull and Mouth near Aldersgate.,

notesStmt.note: Signed at end: G.F., i.e. George Fox.
The first five words of title are enclosed in square brackets.
Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
